events.name: Tuesday 19th May
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo and usually something for dinner. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! I know nothing about programming, is this for me? Yes! We are happy to teach anyone with any experience, if you are a quick learner that makes it even better.
events.location: TradeGecko Office, 101c Telok Ayer, 068574, Singapore

events.name: May Monthly meetup
events.description: After a successful April meetup, here is the details for our may monthly meetup. Agenda ( 45 min talk each) : Introductions and Networking Hypervisor Exploitation and Security by Prasanna K why Penetration Testing sucks by Stefan Streichsbier ( Order of the talk might vary ) Directions to reach venue: Map: Please see the meetup map or follow below street view map. https://www.google.com/maps/@1.280919,103.847042,3a,75y,317.56h,95.79t/data=!3m4!1e1!3m2!1sVb_jjHjK7OEtOoaHIfwSpQ!2e0?hl=en Streetdirectory: http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/car-park-amoy-street-a0006/30317_1.html Landmark: Its opposite to Car Park Via MRT: ThoughtWorks(TW) office is 3 mins away from Telok Ayer MRT (DT, purple line) . TW office is 7 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT (green line), take Exit G and take a left till you reach a right turning road and look for 87 B. Abstract of the talk(s): Hypervisor Exploitation and Security 1. Understanding Architecture of Hypervisor. 2. Exploitation Techniques 3. Existing Exploits and Analysis. For the learning we will use the important Hypervisor, XEN. why Penetration Testing sucks This talk will cover why Penetration Testing sucks and what we should be doing instead. Speaker(s) Bio: Stefan has been focusing on information security since 2003. He is passionate about analysing complex applications through source code reviews and improving their security posture. At Vantage Point he is working on revolutionary approaches to integrate security into the development life cycle with the goal to sustainably eradicate vulnerability classes. Prasanna K: I have been a Application Pentester for close to 10 years. Speaker @ nullcon-Delhi, Clubhack, IIT Guwahati and various null meetups. Enjoy solving new challenges. Creator of IronSAP a module over IronWASP. Present interest is in Fuzzing and UAF bugs discovery. Follow us on twitter @nullsingapore and fb at facebook.com/nullsingapore.
events.location: Thought Works,  Level 3, 87B Amoy Street, 069906, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. events.name: Microsoft Band and Windows 10 IoT Core
events.description: Hi All, Let's do meetup on .NET development. This time, Snake Chia an expert from Malaysia will share with us on how to develop app for Microsoft Band . You are not want to miss this session. See how you can leverage and benefit with this full code demo prersentation. And I will be talking on how to develop Windows 10 IoT Core for Raspberry PI 2. Just imagine you create a normal Windows Universal App in Visual Studio and run it in IoT device. Please join and have fun using .NET. See you there. Regards, Riza Marhaban Organizer
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: May 2015 Data Science Meetup
events.description: UPDATE: Six more days to our meetup and we look forward to meeting our members, especially those first-timers! Due to space constraint, we regret to inform that only those who successfully registered their full names with us can attend the meetup. To find out if you are registered, please click here . Two talks for this particular meetup: 1. IBM: James Pang Topic: Key Technologies behind Business Analytics Bio: Dr. Pang is a Visiting Assistant Professor at the School of Computing, National University of Singapore. He is also a Senior Managing Consultant in IBM with specialty in Analytics and Optimization. Dr. Pang has broad experience inside IBM. Prior to the current role, he was the Client Technical Advisor (Chief Architect, Analytics and Optimization) at IBM Government and Healthcare Center of Competency, and led the IBM technical solution design in ASEAN Public Sector. Before that, he was a Senior Manager at IBM R&D Labs in charge of analytics and optimization product development. Before joining IBM, Dr. Pang was a Research Scientist at Motorola Labs and focused on development and implementation of Operations Research models and methods to solve problems in supply chains and manufacturing systems.Dr. Pang completed his PhD research in Operations Research and System Engineering areas at National University of Singapore (NUS) and Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He completed his Master and Bachelor studies in Engineering at Zhejiang University, China. 2. A*STAR: Alex Chia Synopsis of talk: With the rapid growth in the usage of social networks worldwide, uploading and sharing of user-generated content has become increasingly prevalent. In particular, users are increasingly sharing visual content, often accompanied with limited amount of text. We believe, as social media moves in a more visual direction, monitoring & advertising technologies needs to be more visual. In this talk, we present our technologies which leverage on this new source of data to monitor and track events as well as to profile social media users. Bio: Alex Chia is the Head of Social Media and Internet Vision Analytics Lab and concurrently the Assistant Director of Visual Intelligence Analytics Center of the Institute for Infocomm Research. Dr. Chia was awarded the Tan Sri Dr. Tan Chin Tuan Scholarship in 2004 and the A*STAR Graduate Scholarship in 2006. He was awarded the Tan Kah Kee Young Inventors’ Merit Award and Silver Award in 2009 and 2012 respectively. His research interests include computer vision, image processing and machine learning.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Git Meetup 0.2.0
events.description: It's time for the second meetup! This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute…). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems! Programme: - "Debugging with Git": Ryan Dao Git is more than just a version control system. It's also one of the best debugging tools if used correctly. In this talk I'm going to show how Git and Delta Debugging can be used to help identity issues in your codebase. - "Interactive rebasing with Git": Jason Chionh In this short talk, we'll go through the command "git rebase -i". This is git rebasing in interactive mode. You can use it to organize local commit history. Specifically, we'll look at squashing many commits into one commit and re-ordering commits. - Lightning talk: "Stashing, yo!": Angelo Rohit - Lightning talk: "Pull request, yo!": Lian Hau Lee Come merge with your fellow Gits! Interested in speaking? Please talk to Sahil, Valentine or ChernJie! (We're looking for lightning talks!) Venue and food sponsor: Autodesk Asia (thanks guys!) Address: Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd 1 Fusionopolis Walk #04-11 Solaris North Tower Singapore 138628
events.location: Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd

events.name: Tour to Prefabricated Software-Defined Data Center
events.description:
We will visit a unique & futuristic data center ever built in Singapore and totally different from any traditional data center. We will tour inside its data center and see ourselves how software-defined data center works in real time. You will learn unique technical aspects of power, cooling, cabling, security, fire system in this data center. There will be more data centers to be built with this kind of technological concept. If you want to be in the data center industry for many years to come, you absolutely should not miss this tour. 



You are required to provide your name, NRIC, car plate (if park inside the facility) together with this registration. Without this info the security guard will not allow you to enter the facility. 


The tour is free. 


Disclaimer: This tour is not intended for sales pitch, although it is sponsored by companies. The sponsor may collect your information for their future communication. You can always opt out. 


Please come on time. We may not have a presentation so whoever comes first can start asking questions to the executives. We will keep interactive session until around 3:30pm, then we will tour inside the facility for about 45 minutes. Then we'll stay back for networking until 5pm. If you come later than 3:30pm, you should wait at the security guard until we finish the tour and there will be no repeat tour. As this facility is highly secured, we are always escorted at all time. 


Please bring enough namecards for networking. This meetup is your opportunity to build your networks. 


  
FAQs 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
Yes, you must provide your name & NRIC upon booking.  Also your car plate (if park inside the facility).  Without pre-registering your ID, the security guard will not allow you to enter the facility.  If you are not willing to provide your ID, it is better not to join this tour.  The facility is not a public place.  The tour is strictly for professionals whose work are related to data centre.   
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
You can take public bus or taxi. 
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable?  Can I just show up at the site? 
Not transferrable.  Not sudden show up.
events.location: IO, , 7000 Ang Mo Kio Avenue 5, Singapore null

events.name: Ethereum Visits Singapore
events.description: Join us for this Two-day event to learn more about block chain 2.0 technology and how it applies to the real world. We will provide an introduction to block chain technology and it's use cases apart from bitcoin. The second day of the event will be a coding workshop for everyone of all skill levels to participate and see what kind of interesting programs they can come up with on the block chain. Gavin Wood (Co-Founder of Ethereum), George Hallam and Ken Kappler will be speaking, and we will have live video conferences with a few start ups on the block chain, ie www.provenance.org. DigixGlobal (www.dgx.io), the first smart asset company built on Ethereum's block chain, will be helping to host the event. Calvin Soh will also be guest speaking. He was a creative director for several mnc ad agencies and is currently a branding and marketing consultant for innovative technologies. Amazing dinner will be served so come with empty stomachs and open minds! Spaces are limited so please sign up for this free and informative event!

events.name: Ruby Meetup, RDRC Edition
events.description: Hi everyone! This month we're pushing our regular meetup back to coincide with RDRC and catch up with our international friends in town for Ruby week! If you're in town for the conference, or just in town, come join us for pizza/talks: Date: Tuesday, the 2nd of June, 7.00pm Venue: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, 188969, Singapore We're always looking for new speakers, and we'd especially love to hear from folks who are visiting Singapore that week! Ping us (Anna or Winston) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips (details below). See you there! -------------- 1. 2. 3. 5 Random Ruby Tips * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minute session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com. See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks: Venue:
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: Tutorial on High Performance Cloud Computing Technologies: Julia &OpenTuner
events.description:
This one day tutorial will provide a deep introduction and hands-on experience with two emerging technologies that can help users efficiently utilize cloud resources. 
The first part of the tutorial will cover the Julia programming language. Julia is fast becoming the de facto language of technical computing and is finding new applications every day such as in databases and embedded systems. This workshop will introduce the language and also present use cases for technical computing, statistics, big data applications, high performance, and in education. The workshop, aimed at professionals, researchers, and students, will illustrate how Julia's ease-of-use and fast execution go hand in hand. Upon completion of this workshop, attendees will understand what Julia has to offer over other open source systems such as Python, R, and even commercial systems as well. Julia’s dynamic system allows for scalable fault-tolerant cloud based systems. Examples of Julia running in the cloud will be provided. We will explain Julia’s design including multiple dispatch and the sophisticated type system, and why engineers, scientists, and statisticians can benefit from these concepts. Julia offers a solution to the "two-language problem" whereby one wastefully prototypes in one (slower) language and then deploys in another (faster) language. 
The second part of the tutorial will cover OpenTuner, a open source framework for building domain-specific multi-objective program autotuners, a simple way for improving the performance and efficiency of high performance applications. High performance applications have many tunable parameters. Finding the right values for these parameters for a given architecture is a challenge for many programmers. OpenTuner is a machine learning based framework that provides a simple workflow to find good configurations for even very complex parameter spaces. OpenTuner has been used by a number of different projects to build domain specific autotuners. We will also demonstrate available autotuners for the JVM and gcc that can give an immediate and significant performance boost for existing applications. 




  
Alan Edelman
MIT Mathematics and CSAIL
Professor


  
Jiahao Chen
MIT CSAIL
Research Scientist


  
Saman P Amarasinghe
MIT EECS and CSAIL
Professor
events.location: Stephen Riady Centre LT50 (Level 1), , University Town, 2 College Avenue West, Singapore 138607, Singapore null
events.group_name: Alan Edelman, Saman P. Amarasinghe, and Jiahao Chen

events.name: Get Kanban Workshop
events.description: Most awaited and unique Agile coaching & training workshop in town is LIVE now, Register now RSVP, Limited to 26 attendees The getKanban Board Game is a physical board game designed to teach the concepts and mechanics of Kanban for software development in a workshop setting. It has been described as the most effective way to teach Kanban. It’s hands-on, engaging, and fun.During the workshop the teams construct charts based on data from the game including a Cumulative Flow Diagram, and a Statistical Process Control Chart. Play and Learn Kanban About Maris Maris has 16 years of IT experience as Servant Leader, providing fiscal, strategic &operational leadership in uniquely challenging situations .He orchestrate as Agile Change Agent primarily in the role of Agile Coach and Enterprise agile Transformer.Maris has had extensive experience in architecting agile process solutions using the flavours of Scrum, XP, Kanban and Lean operational waste reduction and implemented in various types of projects. He specializes in XP engineering practices including pair-programming, TDD, ATDD, BDD and continuous integration. He holds Engineering Degree in Electrical and Post graduate in Software systems from BITS and Senior Management from IIM Calcutta. He holds CSM, CSP, PMI-ACP, SAFePC, PMP, PRINCE 2, ITIL, PMOC, TOGAF9, DAD-YB, and SCEA. How to reach, Step by step instructions: http://bit.ly/1bqTbB4
events.location: 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261, 261, Waterloo Street,#04-35, Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261

events.name: ETSY Craft Party 2015 SINGAPORE
events.description:
Etsy is a marketplace where people around the world connect, both online and offline, make, sell and buy unique goods. Since 2010, Etsy has hosted Etsy Craft Party, a global celebration of meeting and making.  
This is the 3rd party in Singapore and we would like to invite you to come and celebrate this big day with us. Consider it like a Handmade Craft Holiday! 
This year's theme is Kaleidoscope: Paper Taking Shape. We will explore and make a few crafts with paper. How many pieces of papers form a picture? Let's create a variety of collage and paper cutting techniques. One of the crafts we'll be making is paper weaving. Combine your favorite images with embellishments like ribbon, yarn, colored paper, magazine pages, or even your child’s artwork, and you’ll have a one-of-a-kind statement piece to display in your home. 
ETSY CRAFT PARTY 
6 June 2015 
Time: 2-6pm 
Place: The Playtent  
Sign up today to find out what other fun crafts we will be making on the 6th! 
https://www.etsy.com/local/craftparty/event/23279223368/etsy-craft-party-2015-singapore-june-6 
BUT secure your seat through payment on this Eventbrite page. We can only take in those who have RSVP-ed and make payment. 
Add us on FB or instagram @simply4love and join our FB Group here 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/etsycraftivistsg/ 
For any questions, please email us at simply4love@ymail.com or whatapp 8298 4274 or 9067 0847. 
See you soon! 
#craftparty @etsy
events.location: The Playtent, , 180 Joo Chiat Road #02-01, Singapore 427451

events.name: The World's Largest Pyramids in Bosnia by Dr Sam Semir Osmanagich
events.description:
You are invited to a very special afternoon of delight, wonder and astonishing truths.   
Be in the room with the discoverer, archeological and multidisciplinary researcher of the world's largest pyramid and oldest man made structure to date, Dr Sam Semir Osmanagich.   He will be here personally in Singapore to share about his fascinating discoveries of The Bosnian Pyramids of the Sun, Moon, Dragon, Love and the Temple of Mother Earth. 
You will get to hear the very latest exciting updates that he and his relentless team has made and very important information on possible purpose of the pyramids and the multiple effects it has on the health and inner well being of humanity and planet earth. 
Bosnia, a once war-torn country now coming out from the ashes to offer deep peace, healing and harmony to the world. Dr Osmanagich believes that the pyramids do not belong to Bosnia, they are for every human being on this earth. 
We welcome you to join us for an intimate journey to the fascinating world of The Bosnian Pyramids! 
This discovery is destined to change our whole history and perception of the world as we know of it. 
This project is now rewriting history to reflect the astonishing truths that advanced human civilisations existed in the distant past and that ancient technology was far superior to what our textbooks have told us. 
We will close the talk with a relaxation exercise, connecting with the sounds from the Sun and Moon pyramids. 
About Dr Sam Semir Osmanagich 
http://www.semirosmanagic.com/en/index.html 
Dr Sam Osmangich holds his doctorate in Sociology of History. His PhD thesis about the Mayan civilization has been accepted at the University of Sarajevo. 
To date, he has discovered ten artificial structures: besides the group of Bosnian Pyramids, the Vratnica Tumulus, Dolovi Tumulus, Ginje Tumulus, KTK Tunnel, and Ravne Tunnel Labyrinth. 
He has established non-profit and non-government "Archaeological Park: Bosnian Pyramid of the Sun" Foundation to pursue the excavation and geo-archaeological work. 
Osmanagich has authored ten books about ancient civilizations on The Mayan World, Peruvian, Mexican, Pacific, African and ancient European civilizations that have been published worldwide. 
He narrated a 12-episode documentary "Search for Lost Civilization" for the state Bosnian television which was based on his book: "Civilizations Before the Official History" which was filmed in Peru, Bolivia, Easter Island, Costa Rica, Mexico, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Malta, Egypt, Jordan and Lebanon. 
The Sarajevo daily newspaper awarded Osmanagich the title of "Man of the Year 2007 in Bosnia-Herzegovina" for his research project, Bosnian Valley of the Pyramids, and for his affirmative promotion of Bosnia-Herzegovina in the world. 
Osmanagich has been admitted as a Foreign Member of the Russian Academy of Natural Sciences in Moscow, one of the most respected scientific institutions in the world. 
He lectures openly and extensively internationally to share the important information relevant to the upliftment of humanity. 
*This event is free in the service of expanding human consciousness though donations will be much appreciated. 100% of all proceeds will go towards the continual excavation and research work of the Pyramids in Bosnia. 
Entry is strictly by Registration ONLY.   1. Send us your name, mobile number and numbers attending. contact@thevisionaryartworkshop.com  
2.  Print out your ticket on any recycled paper and present on the day.  
*Seats are limited. Please ONLY Regsiter if you are coming as each seat reserved will be payable by a kind sponsor of this event. 
*Do plan your travel time to arrive a little earlier to avoid disruption to others and the speaker. 
*This event is free in the service of education and expanding human consciousness though donations will be much appreciated.  100% of all proceeds will go towards the continual excavation and research work of the Pyramids in Bosnia. 
Registration at door: 2pm Doors will be closed: 245pm sharp.
events.location: Medical Alumni Association, ,  2 College Road, Singapore, Singapore 169850

events.name: Front End TL;DR June 2015
events.description: ReferralCandy is where we'll meet up. Come see what their front end engineering team is doing, and spend an evening learning the latest front end technology. Address: Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #06-26, Singapore 139951 FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #06-26, Singapore 139951

events.name: Papers We Love SG #010
events.description: Paper #1 - The Derivative of a Regular Type is its Type of One-Hole Contexts : Érdi Gergő - http://strictlypositive.org/diff.pdf Paper #2 - A Protocol for Packet Network Intercommunication: Sayanee Basu - http://www.cs.princeton.edu/courses/archive/fall06/cos561/papers/cerf74.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: Live Trading With Harmonics - Sharing Seminar
events.description:
Live Trading With Harmonics - Make money together seminar 
 
 
HarmonicForex,com(HFX Pte Ltd) is proud to present a brand new series of seminar where we will do live trading together with our participants in a 2 hour seminar. 
Through feedback from conducting about 3 years worth of seminars, we realized what our participants really wanted from us. Even though our seminars usually run full house all the time, we realized that a tweak of our seminar content could really help us reach out to more traders out there who might be struggling in trading. 
These were the top 3 requests. 
1. Live Trading 
2. Shorter term trading (More M15 and H1 trade setups instead of exclusively H4 or Daily setups) 
3. More sharing about the methodology and trade management 
You asked for it, you got it! 
  
What time does it start and is my seat guaranteed? 
Registration will start at 6.30pm and we will start at 7pm sharp. 
Late participants might be refused entry to avoid disruption to the seminar. 
  
Harmonics, Harmonic Trading, HarmonicForex? 
If this is the first time you heard about us, allow me to introduce to you what Harmonic Trading is, who we are and what we do. 
About Harmonic Trading 
 
Harmonic trading is a form of price action trading system which has stood the test of time and proven to be effective over multiple market conditions.  
Developed in the US over 75 years ago, it is a strategy that blends in the art of Fibonacci, Elliot Waves & human psychology to produce reliable & profitable trading ideas. It helps traders to identify high probability trade ideas with well-defined trade entries and exits. 
  
Who are we & what we do? 
 
HarmonicForex is a leading Forex education firm founded in Singapore which has been the broker's choice for trading education for the past 3 years. We conduct workshops on trading and have ran about 9 intakes of our flagship Harmonicforex RTM course over 2 years that has only been growing in numbers.  
A recent survey conducted with our institution partners revealed the top 3 reasons on why they like to work with us. 

Trustworthy & engaging trainers, who have captured the trust of many participants with our sincere, transparent sharing of knowledge & trading results
No hard selling, comprehensive suit of courses and services that suit traders of all levels
No complains after our seminars

 
 
What is in for me as a participant?
 

 
 We understand that times have changed and seminar attendees are getting more and more selective.
 
We do not wish to waste your time too, that is why we want you to know what exactly you can take away from our seminars. 
 

Quality Harmonic Trading Education (In-Depth drawing of patterns on MT4)
Get to know yourself and your system better through a self-awareness survey which will be conducted at the start of the seminar
Live trading calls which might or might not work out
Limited time offers in the event that you wish to engage our services
1 month free trial of our HarmonicForex Signal Service which was launched in May 2015 with raving reviews

 
Is this seminar suitable for me?
 
If you face the following issues in your trading, you should attend our seminar.

No proper system which you can rely on to trade Forex
No comprehensive risk management and trade management system instilled in your trading
No knowledge about the Harmonic Trading system and wants to find out more
Have been disappointed by and paid many dodgy educators who refused to reveal their trading results
In search of a customized trading system that suits my personality and lifestyle

 
Credibility of our trainers
 

(Trainer Terry(Far Left) with John Bollinger(Middle) and other financial trainers)
 Our trainers have collectively 30 years of trading experience and have successful profited across many market condition. They are recognized by many reputable financial institutions(see banner below) as experts in the Forex education industry.
 

 
They do not possess any certifications like CFA, CFTe or CTA, but they make it up by being brave enough to reveal their LIVE trading results infront of their audiences. They believe that in trading, their results is the best certification and they are very proud to share all their experiences and secrets with the seminar participants.
 
What some of our participants has to say
 

 

 

 
 

 
About our Trainers
 
Terry Tan

 
Terry is the founder of HarmonicForex. A veteran trader with 9 years of trading experience, he believes that trading is one of the few skills that can be learnt. His passion is to enable all his followers to make a profit from the Forex market through genuine sharing in this blog as well as in his seminars. Terry is featured quite frequently in the media alongside other reputable financial trainers in the industry, having worked with various financial institutions and winning them over with his transparency and openness to share his knowledge.  
  
Snehath Dias  
  
 
Snehath Dias is the chief trainer of HarmonicForex.com. He is also a prolific speaker and trader who had represented HarmonicForex.com in various trading events organized in Singapore. Being an extremely busy Regional Director of a listed company, he will share with the audience how he managed to juggle his busy career, passion in trading and family time perfectly. He was once a NSL trader who lost faith in trading before he reworked himself to become a successful trader today. Come hear his story about how he managed to pick himself up and reach his goals despite all the challenges he has to overcome.
events.location: IG Singapore, , 9 Battery Road, #01-02 Straits Trading Building, Singapore 049910

events.name: ISS Seminar - Online Collaboration: Fact or Fiction?
events.description:
Online Collaboration is the child of Knowledge Management and the Internet, a new paradigm of professional cooperation in organisations made possible by the social capabilities of the web. It is also the open secret to solving the productivity problems entrenched in many companies stuck in the world of emails and silos. Implementing and adopting online collaboration is, however, easier said than done.  
In this seminar, you will hear: 

State of online collaboration in Singapore
Overview of selected online collaboration tools
The importance of culture and adoption

 Who Should Attend Social Media Folks: professionals in the business of dealing with social, digital, marketing, branding, content, development and strategy, especially internal social. If you’re keen to find out what’s going to be relevant and beneficial to your business and life in the fast-paced world of social, this seminar is for you.  
For detailed agenda, visit https://www.iss.nus.edu.sg/Events/ISSSeminars/OnlineCollaborationFactorFiction.aspx 
  
  
Please note that this site is not developed nor maintained by the Institute of Systems Science at the National University of Singapore (NUS-ISS).  This is a third party independent site subject to its own data protection and privacy practices and you are encouraged to examine them before proceeding to share your personal data.  NUS-ISS will collect, use and/or disclose the personal data submitted through this third party independent site for the purpose of administration and/or management of the event.
events.location: Institute of Systems Science, NUS, , 25 Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 119615

events.name: BayesiaLab Workshop: Artificial Intelligence for Research, Analytics, and Reasoning
events.description:
In fields ranging from bioinformatics to marketing science, Bayesian networks have revolutionized the way scientists explore high-dimensional problem domains. And, since the first release of the BayesiaLab software package in 2001, practitioners have been able to leverage this powerful paradigm for their research without having to write a single line of code. 
Learn what the Bayesian networks revolution is all about, and join Stefan Conrady and Dr. Lionel Jouffe for a complimentary workshop on knowledge discovery with Bayesian networks and BayesiaLab. In the presentation, we will first lay out the basics of the Bayesian network formalism and then illustrate a practical application in a live software demo. 
Target Audience: 
Applied researchers, statisticians, data scientists, data miners, biologists, biostatisticians, epidemiologists, predictive modelers, econometricians, economists, engineers, market researchers, knowledge managers, marketing scientists, social scientists, students and teachers in related fields.
events.location: Matrix @ Biopolis, , 30 Biopolis St, Level 4, Singapore 138671

events.name: 2-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101
events.description:
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore 
"Currently, Bayesian Networks have become one of the most complete, self-sustained and coherent formalisms used for knowledge acquisition, representation and application through computer systems." (Bouhamed et al., 2015) 
Join this course to learn about the principles of Bayesian networks and how to apply them for research and analytics with the BayesiaLab software platform. You will see that Bayesian networks are ideally suited to model a wide range of high-dimensional problem domains. Overall, this course's focus in on leveraging Bayesian networks for applied research, with the objective of solving problems that currently appear difficult or intractable with traditional statistical methods. 
This "short course" is a compact version of the highly acclaimed 3-Day Introductory BayesiaLab Course, which we have been offering around the world for almost ten years. We have designed this new 2-day course for scientists who are interested in utilizing Bayesian networks for their research, but for whom the current 3-day program might be too much of a time commitment. 
Throughout this course, we exclusively use the BayesiaLab software platform. Therefore, you have access to a full license of BayesiaLab Professional for a 30-day period starting on the first day of the course. This gives you the opportunity to replicate all examples from the course at your leisure on your own computer. 
 
Date and Location 
July 2-3, 2015 9:00am-5:00pm (both days) 
Singapore Management University School of Accountancy 60 Stamford Road Seminar Room 2.5 Singapore 178899 
Overview 
Day 1 

Introductory Examples of Probabilistic Reasoning:
Prosecutor's Fallacy
Simpson's Paradox
Bayes' Rule and the Bayesian Network Formalism
Graph Structures, d-Separation
Encoding Bayesian Networks from Domain Knowledge
Omnidirectional Inference for Diagnosis and Simulation
Observation versus Intervention/Causation

Day 2 

Prerequisites for Machine-Learning Bayesian Networks:
Information Theory, incl. Entropy, Mutual Information, Minimum Description Length
Unsupervised Structural Learning for Knowledge Discovery
Supervised Learning for Predictive Modeling, Feature Selection
Variable Clustering
Data Clustering
Latent Factor Inductions and Probabilistic Structural Equation Models
Network Analysis and Simulation
Using Bayesian Networks for Decision Support

What's required?  

Working knowledge of specifying and estimating linear models.
No prior knowledge of Bayesian networks or Bayesian statistics is required.
No programming skills are required. You will use the graphical user interface of BayesiaLab for all exercises in class.

Who should attend?  
Bioinformaticians, biostatisticians, clinical scientists, computer scientists, data scientists, decision scientists, demographers, ecologists, econometricians, economists, epidemiologists, knowledge managers, management scientists, market researchers, marketing scientists, operations research analysts, policy analysts, predictive modelers, research investigators, risk managers, social scientists, statisticians, plus students and teachers of related fields. 
Two-Day Short Course: Bayesian Networks & BayesiaLab 101 in Singapore
events.location: Singapore Management University, School of Accountancy, , 60 Stamford Road, Seminar Room 2.5, Singapore 178899
